author: Gerald F. Seib
title: How Democrats Could Lose Their Midterm Edge
text:
Hall of Fame pitcher Satchel Paige once said, famously: “Don’t look back. Something might be gaining on you.” It’s advice Democrats might want to heed.

For months Democrats have been assuming that a series of advantages—principally President Donald Trump’s historically low approval ratings, but also the traditional success of an out-of-power party in midterm elections, an energized party base and a raft of retirements by congressional Republicans—were coming together to produce a wave that could return control of Congress...
